question_text: Entomologist Erica McAlister has observed that the complex flight patterns of certain fly species, particularly hoverflies, are not merely random movements; instead, they are sophisticated aerial maneuvers that serve several crucial functions, from evading predators to attracting mates. These intricate patterns, often characterized by rapid changes in direction and velocity, ____________________________________________________________________________ the flies to navigate complex environments and perform their essential life functions with remarkable agility.
